programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
Tempers flare at a freight depot in Perth, where a husband-and-wife team are sent back on the same journey that took them two days to complete and was delayed by poor weather
S01E05

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
Return of the documentary following workers in the heavy recovery business. In Corby a 16-metre lorry loaded with waste flips over near a busy roundabout
S06E01

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
In Huddersfield, officers are in pursuit of a van driver who smashed his van into a parked car before fleeing, while Bob and Dan pepper spray a suspect who is not keen on being handcuffed. Chris and Chris go after a stolen car whose driver gets too close to some railings, and the Operational Support Unit deal with a suspected heroin user carrying a number of bank cards and needles
S16E10

programme.title: Bandolero! (1968)
programme.desc: An outlaw due to be hanged is rescued at the last minute by his brother, and together they go on the run with a hostage, hotly pursued by the local sheriff. As the fugitives contemplate giving up a life of crime, they face a dangerous run-in with a gang of Mexican bandits. Western, with James Stewart, Dean Martin, Raquel Welch and George Kennedy

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Young Guns of Texas (1962)
programme.desc: A disgraced military cadet goes in search of the thieves who stole an army payroll. He is soon joined by three other men after the reward money, but they are pursued in turn by an angry rancher after one of them elopes with his daughter. As the three groups catch up with each other, they all face a common threat in a band of hostile Apaches. Western, starring James Mitchum and Alana Ladd

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
A team tries to rescue an overturned mixer full of wet cement, while, after a week-long holiday in Italy, a returning driver discovers problems in her hydraulics
S06E02

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
Steve Grahame hauls vital power-generating equipment to Kalumburu, an isolated community in the far north-west of Australia
S02E01

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dan and Tom have their hands full with a driver who is four times over the limit and still refuses to come quietly even when he's bundled into the back of the police car. Sophie and Adie stop a carload of lads at five in the morning and the driver is over the limit, but it's what's down his trousers that is more of a concern
S16E12

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A gang of burglars breaks into a house and takes the keys to luxury cars. After the thieves flee in three stolen vehicles, multiple teams hunt them down with the police chopper. The first burglar is caught after a lengthy pursuit of a stolen Mercedes, which he abandons before running straight into the path of waiting officers. Once the occupants of a second stolen Merc are apprehended by the chopper team, Ben and Warren go after the third vehicle - which they are stunned to witness burst into flames
S16E13

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dog handler Duncan and the firearms team find themselves in a tense stand-off with suspected drug dealers who could be armed, with German shepherd Tia sent in to search and discovering more than the unit bargained for. Steve has to deal with two teens, one who has crashed a stolen car, and the other who has been involved in a bar brawl, while Kev is poised to take out a car with a stinger
S16E14

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Exploring how some young people who commit crimes on the street take their first steps into a life of lawlessness, from terrorising communities to involvement with criminal gangs
S06E05

programme.title: HMP Belmarsh: Maximum Security
programme.desc: A look inside HMP Belmarsh prison, from the gangs that have dominated its corridors to the brave officers who serve there, and some of the prison's most infamous inmates. The documentary brings to life in graphic detail the vicious conflicts and unthinkable acts of violence that are part of daily life inside Belmarsh, offering a harrowing insight into what life is really like in the prison

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Firefighters battle through apocalyptic scenes on Australia's Kangaroo Island as it is besieged by deadly bushfires
S04E07

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:
Documentary following the work of Allelys, one of the leading multimodal logistics and specialist projects providers in the country. A team of experts prepares to transport two gigantic pieces of electric equipment 40 miles using two specially adapted rigs, but from too-small exit gates through multiple roundabouts and ending with a weak bridge, the journey is anything but certain
S01E01

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
999: Criminals: Caught on Camera: Journalist Nick Wallis presents more shocking footage of crimes in progress. In Leicester, the fatal stabbing of a football coach leads to a devastating house fire, started as the result of a botched revenge attack. The incident claimed the lives of a family, and CCTV records are used to track down eight young men responsible for starting the blaze. Also featured is a helicopter-based manhunt for a gun-toting criminal hiding out in back gardens, and a brutal assault in Cambridge in which a gang of men set upon two defenceless partygoers
S03E03

programme.title: Seconds from Death: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Deadliest Bail Outs: How an oxygen-starved climber survived on the world's highest mountain. Plus, the story of the father-and-son duo who found themselves trapped by the ferocious flames of a wildfire
S01E04

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
In Northampton, 40-ton heavy loader carrying cardboard bales tips onto its side blocking a busy A-road. On a Midlands mission, snow threatens to leave rescuer Mark stranded, while the quaint rural roads of Staffordshire seemingly prove no match for former army boy Jim
S01E02

programme.title: Flaming Star (1960)
programme.desc: The son of a Native American mother and a white father faces a test of loyalties when he is caught on the racial divide as a Kiowa tribe go on the warpath and white settlers carry out brutal reprisal attacks. Whereas he is drawn to side with his mother's people, his half-brother takes the opposing view. Western, starring Elvis Presley, Steve Forrest, Barbara Eden, Richard Jaeckel and Dolores Del Rio

programme.title: Flame of the Barbary Coast (1945)
programme.desc: A cattle rancher falls for a San Francisco saloon-bar singer, but she proves to be in cahoots with a ruthless card sharp who wins all his money. Not to be outdone, he sets out to hone his card-playing skills for a rematch, unaware the city is poised on the brink of disaster. Romantic drama, starring John Wayne, Ann Dvorak and Joseph Schildkraut

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
Crouch incident manger Steve and his team have been called out to a lorry that has caught fire on the extremely busy A1. By the time Steve arrives, the fire has been put out and Callum has pulled the tractor unit onto a low loader
S06E03

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
A large convoy tries to escape Perth before sunset, and the future of Steve Grahame's trip hangs on a phone call to his mechanic
S02E02

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers go in pursuit of a driver who is so drunk that he can't even keep his car on the road and the chase ends with shocking results. Elsewhere, dog handler Tony encounters a naked man stranded at the side of the road, and Sophie is forced to buy a treat for the entire team due to a rookie mistake
S16E15

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
The firearms team mobilises to tackle a suspect armed with a pistol, and hours into a nerve-shredding siege, the man emerges with a handgun and fires. Elsewhere, interceptors Rob and Dan join in the pursuit of a runaway hatchback, while the members of the knife crime team track down a suspect on a bike trying to evade capture in a park
S19E01

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
In North Yorkshire, more than a thousand drink-drivers are arrested every year meaning police are always looking out for suspicious cars and drivers taking their chances. Near Wetherby, a pursuit of a suspected drug driver reaches speeds of 130 mph before it ends with a head-on smash with a police car, while police receive reports that a driver has crashed his car down an embankment into a holiday home near Scarborough and fled the scene. Suspicions run high when a driver collides with a motorbike and then downs pints of beer in his local pub straight after the accident
S12E19

programme.title: Shooter (2007)
programme.desc: A former Marine sniper is coaxed back into action when government officials need his help to prevent an assassination attempt on the US president. However, the intended target is in fact an African archbishop, and the marksman is set up by double-crossing agents to take the fall, forcing him to go on the run as he fights to clear his name. Action thriller, with Mark Wahlberg, Michael Pena and Danny Glover

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Contraband (2012)
programme.desc: Successful international smuggler Chris Farraday turns his back on a life of crime to raise a family. However, his brother-in-law crosses a powerful drug lord, who forces Chris to transport billions of dollars of counterfeit money into the US, or his wife and children will be killed. Crime thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg, Kate Beckinsale, Giovanni Ribisi and Ben Foster

programme.title: Contraband (2012)

programme.title: Beware
programme.desc:
Beware: Car Crash Britain: The use of CCTV cameras to make Britain's streets safer. Police In London turn up the heat on the moped gangs terrorising the city, while uniformed officers use CCTV and force helicopter I99 to pursue offenders and stop them from carrying out more raids. Sgt Callum Roy co-ordinates operations in the control centre, dealing with a high-speed pursuit and wily bike thieves who try and give his officers the slip. Plus, dashboard and helmet cameras and mobile phones captures angry motorists turning to violence over the smallest of disagreements
S01E01

programme.title: Seconds from Death: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
World's Deadliest Hang Outs: A couple of isolated hunters try to handle a deadly role reversal, and an urban free-climber turns harmless hangouts into near-death experiences
S01E05

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
Crouch Recovery is sent in to save the day when a double-deck HGV rolls over on the A6, while recovery operative Rob delivers a wrecked cab to a salvage yard
S01E03

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S02E08

programme.title: Posse from Hell (1961)
programme.desc: Bandits invade a frontier town, rob the bank, kill the sheriff and kidnap a local woman. A tough gunslinger who was a friend of the dead lawman takes on the job of bringing them to justice, but the only one of the townspeople willing to help is a naive banker determined to prove his worth. Western, starring Audie Murphy, John Saxon, Vic Morrow and Lee Van Cleef

Western, starring Stephen McNally, Willard Parker, Coleen Gray and Arthur Shields

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Rob and Spence respond to a reported knife attack, arriving to find the victim is on her way to hospital while the suspect is locked in a property and making threats against police. Negotiations take a turn when the slurring suspect topples out of an upstairs window, crashing to the patio below. Out on the roads, Lisa and Lewis assist Lenny with the arrest of a tricky trio who are suspected of stealing an elderly man's car
S19E04

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers Gav Hall and Dan Mottishaw are in hot pursuit of a suspected drug dealer, but the two-wheeled tearaway runs out of road, flips his bike over and crashes into a hedge. Elsewhere, a man wanted for ABH gives interceptors Lewis Marshall and Darren Chalk the runaround, and Jen Ellse pulls over a suspected uninsured driver, who struggles to explain the fake plates in his boot
S19E05

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Following police on a manhunt for a dangerous suspect, as dog-handler Jen and crime-fighting canine Quantum search in the dark for the assailant. A crackdown on cannabis cultivation leads police to £500,000 worth of Class B drugs farmed in a disused warehouse, and on the roads, a van with false plates causes complete carnage
S19E07

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:
Dave hauls a 68-tonne transformer through the back roads of Suffolk, avoiding weaker bridges and tackling narrow countryside roads. Smurf faces delays during a time-sensitive job
S02E07

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
Graham's race through the desert takes a sudden turn, while it is hard rock and hard knocks on an urgent run to the races for young trucker Will

programme.title: WWE: Raw Highlights
programme.desc:
Wrestling action with the superstars of WWE, including Drew McIntyre, AJ Styles, Becky Lynch, Randy Orton and Seth Rollins. Presented by Tom Phillips, Samoa Joe and Byron Saxton
S01E172

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Yorkshire police forces tackling an ever-more sophisticated criminal fraternity from the cities to the Dales. Police from the north and west of the historic county crack down on drug-addled drivers, and it is North Yorkshire's Roads Policing Group that faces the toughest challenge when a convicted drug dealer leads officers on a 140mph chase on one of the UK's busiest motorways. Jamie Theakston narrates
S01E01

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:
Steve Moss delivers a 60-ton reel of electrical cable for an ambitious green energy scheme, only for the convoy to be brought to a halt by a single swan

programme.desc:

programme.title: Westbound (1959)
programme.desc: A former Union soldier is employed by a stagecoach company to guard a large gold shipment being transported across the country. Meanwhile, a loyal follower of the defeated Confederacy is plotting to steal the bullion to revive the cause, but his plans are confounded by traitorous henchmen and his wife, who was once the lover of the Union veteran. Western, with Randolph Scott, Andrew Duggan and Virginia Mayo

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
The documentary follows Nottinghamshire officers in an operation to stop a van that intel suggests is packed with cocaine, and after detaining two suspects and seizing the van the team gets the green light to take the vehicle apart to find any hidden drugs. Behind the wheel of an unmarked car, Dan activates stealth mode as he tracks down a thief fresh from the scene of a house burglary and using a stolen Mercedes as a getaway car
S19E09

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers from the knife crime team give chase when a handcuffed suspect makes a break for it, but with his hands behind his back he soon face-plants into the tarmac. Meanwhile, stakes are high as the interceptors comb the streets for a man who has threatened to stab his former partner and harm her horse
S19E11

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers pursue a vehicle with obscured number plates and it charges off the wrong way down the A46, while Dan and Jules stop a disqualified driver who is in a unique disguise. Police also respond to a report of an alleged carjacking at knife point, and there are tears before bedtime for a car of teenagers
S22E01

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc:
Banged Up: HMP Wormwood Scrubs: The history of the famous prison, which has been used to incarcerate everyone from serial killers Ian Brady and Peter Sutcliffe to rock stars Pete Doherty and Keith Richards. The programme examines its use by MI5 in the Second World War, the story of a Soviet spy who escaped, and perhaps the most well-known inmate, the infamous Charles Bronson
S02E02

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Exploring how some young people who commit crimes on the street take their first steps into a life of lawlessness, from terrorising communities to involvement with criminal gangs

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A stick of dynamite causes chaos for Duggie when it is brought into Carlisle's main police station and the armed response unit is called out after there is a report of a gun being spotted in a city centre bar. Duncan receives a shock when a cyclist who has been trapped under a car turns out to be someone he knows, officers haul in a driver who is well over the limit and Hayley comes to the rescue when a teenager's car hits a wall during a late-night drive. Documentary following the work of Cumbria's Roads Policing Unit
S05E02

programme.title: Fights, Camera, Action!
programme.desc:
Hell on Wheels: Clip show of dramatic confrontations filmed by eye-witnesses, presented by George Lamb. This episode looks at rage on two wheels - hostile and aggressive encounters between bicyclists or motorcyclists and cars, pedestrians, thieves, and of course other bikers
S01E01

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:
To haul a 190-ton reel of steel crane cable, driver Zack steers his 144-wheeled, 60-ton trailer from Warwickshire to Worksop to first load and then take it to Immingham docks

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
On one of the UK's busiest roads, a jack-knifed HGV has careered through a front garden, over a ditch and blocked a lane of traffic. Meanwhile, Jim's mettle is tested and Steve has to quell a rebellion

programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
999: Criminals: Caught on Camera: Journalist Nick Wallis presents more shocking footage of crimes in progress. In Leicester, the fatal stabbing of a football coach leads to a devastating house fire, started as the result of a botched revenge attack. The incident claimed the lives of a family, and CCTV records are used to track down eight young men responsible for starting the blaze. Also featured is a helicopter-based manhunt for a gun-toting criminal hiding out in back gardens, and a brutal assault in Cambridge in which a gang of men set upon two defenceless partygoers
S03E03

programme.title: Beware
programme.desc:
Beware: Car Crash Britain: The use of CCTV cameras to make Britain's streets safer. Police In London turn up the heat on the moped gangs terrorising the city, while uniformed officers use CCTV and force helicopter I99 to pursue offenders and stop them from carrying out more raids. Sgt Callum Roy co-ordinates operations in the control centre, dealing with a high-speed pursuit and wily bike thieves who try and give his officers the slip. Plus, dashboard and helmet cameras and mobile phones captures angry motorists turning to violence over the smallest of disagreements
S01E01

999: Criminals: Caught on Camera: Documentary in which journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 16/05/2023: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc:
Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville hear from tenants living with damp, mould and a rat infestation under Britain's biggest housing association. Plus, the difference in recycling rules across counties
S15E02

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc:
A look at the cameras fitted with artificial intelligence software that are being used to detect when a driver is using their mobile phone. Plus, the police teams with night-vision kits who are taking on criminals who prey on isolated rural communities
S03E02

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc:
The officers team up with Ed Sheeran's manager to take on ticket touts scamming music fans out of millions. They also investigate a couple conning people out of their pensions
S05E02

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Dion heads to Birmingham to meet the new owners of a property bought at auction while Martin is on a tour of Wales, investigating properties in Treherbert and Swansea
S26E23

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Eccleston 24: Experts Caroline Hawley and Roo Irvine help two teams look for items in an antiques centre in the Lancashire town of Eccleston. Eric Knowles overseeing proceedings and also attempts a spot of morris dancing, discovering the history of the humble clog and the part it played in Lancashire's industrial heritage
S54E27

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:
Lost Time: Sid and Kirsty have to rally under pressure as they encounter a patient who is running out of time
S24E64

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc:
Jacqui Joseph scours Altrincham Recycling Centre in Greater Manchester, picking out four bar stools to work on herself, as well as a cast-iron bench for blacksmiths Bex Simon and Dave Harris and a gentleman's wardrobe for screen printer Daniel Heath
S12E02

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Cornwall: Nicki Chapman visits Cornwall where she has some homes lined up to tempt a buyer from suburban Surrey who is looking for a fresh start for him and his grandson
S23E45

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
Sellers try to get the best prices for a set of medical posters, a 1950s toy helicopter, a life-size ceramic sheep, a small toy wooden horse and a retro set of table and chairs
S03E22

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Saddle-maker Suzie Fletcher is called upon to restore a child's shoe that acted as an unlikely talisman for the owner's father and grandfather through two world wars. Metal expert Dominic Chinea and electronics whizz Mark Stuckey put their heads together to get a vintage vacuum cleaner working again, and ceramicist Kirsten Ramsey pieces together a broken doll's tea set
S09E07

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Sally Lindsay joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz, in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the most obscure answers
S28E07

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat with Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim organises a karaoke leaving party for Lola but forgets to hire a karaoke machine. Eve becomes suspicious of Stacey and Kat tries to stick up for Alfie when she learns Elaine wants rid of him at The Vic

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc:
Kim is rocked by a blast from the past and a new pupil causes problems. Joe and Mike begin to question their future as they are faced with the realities of fatherhood. Kai struggles with his feeling for Preston and Danny makes a bold move as his future hangs in the balance
S02E01

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The remaining 14 chefs kick off Knockout Week by being split into two groups. The first group of seven cook a dish that they would have on the menu of their own restaurant or pop-up, or would feature in their cookbook. Guest judge Anna Haugh joins John Torode to decide which five will go on to cook at a restaurant and which two will be going home. The remaining five head to Kings Cross in London to work at Decimo under chef Peter Sanchez-Iglesias. During a busy lunch service, the five amateurs will be entirely responsible for serving the restaurant's menu to paying customers
S19E16

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc:
You Just Haven't Earned It Yet, Baby: After receiving some news that might change her circumstances, Costello prepares to leave London with Iris. But as mounting pressure online threatens to take away their escape route, Costello falls back into bad habits. After a visit from Fen, Selby opens up about his father and gets heated with his therapist. Gloria struggles to come to terms with becoming a mother
S01E07

programme.title: The Truth About
programme.desc: Over the past 12 months, a team from Imperial College London, in collaboration with the BBC, have surveyed the mental health of over 350,000 people across the UK during the Covid-19 pandemic. Now, clinical psychologist Professor Tanya Byron joins former England footballer Alex Scott to discover how the latest science can help us gain greater control over our state of mind and improve mental health and wellbeing

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc:

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc:

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Dion Dublin is in Wolverhampton to see a three-bedrom, end-of-terrace house with scope to extend. He's also in Willenhall in the West Midlands to visit a bungalow which might offer more potential as a new building plot. In Norfolk, Tommy Walsh visits a three-bedroom house that he's a big fan of
S24E39

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc:

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
West Yorkshire: With their current townhouse bursting at the seams, today's couple - along with their five children and two dogs - need Ginny Buckley's help to find a large rural property. In West Yorkshire, they get the local lowdown from both Ginny and her mum Maggie. Having grown up in the area, Ginny also finds out what it is to be a proud Yorkshire person

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:

programme.desc:

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and his team of experts meet Liz from Dorset who brings in a crumbling cast-iron gate built by her brother as a gift for her and her late husband. Horologist Steve Fletcher and leather expert Suzie Fletcher are brought a century-old watch by Nancy who's father was awarded the watch for his bravery on his return from the First World War. Upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary takes on a rocking chair that has been at the heart of Anna's family home for decades and is in desperate need of some TLC. Last into the shop is Ruth and her Auntie Roz who bring in a penny arcade game from the 1920s
S06E14

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. Larry Gaines fought professionally from 1923 and refused to let prejudice hamper his career. He was the first black boxer to fight in the Royal Albert Hall and his family is immensely proud of him. Also being restored are a pair of old football boots and a vintage globe. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

An incident in which a train driver suffered facial injuries after a brick was hurled at his cab, shattering the window. The train was travelling at 70mph, but the driver managed to bring it safely to a standstill, despite his injuries. Rav Wilding reports on how attacks like this have prompted one train company to start installing on-board technology, aimed at making journeys safer for passengers and staff

He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. programme.desc:
How a young couple's new glamping business was threatened when their Instagram account was hacked into and taken over. The hacker demanded $500 to hand back control - but they stood their ground. Incidents like this are increasingly common, with more than half of small businesses suffering a cyberattack in the last 12 months. Rav Wilding looks at the work being done by West Midlands Cybercrime Unit to combat the problem

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. Presented by Jay Blades

Guest judge Anna Haugh joins John Torode to decide which five will go on to cook at a restaurant and which two will be going home. The remaining five head to Kings Cross in London to work at Decimo under chef Peter Sanchez-Iglesias. During a busy lunch service, the five amateurs will be entirely responsible for serving the restaurant's menu to paying customers

programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The second group of seven hopefuls compete for the chance to work in a professional kitchen for the first time. They must cook a dish they would have on the menu of their own restaurant or pop-up, or feature in their cookbook. With Gregg unwell, Monica Galetti joins John Torode to decide which two will be going home, after which the remaining five work in the Royal Opera House's Piazza restaurant, under the guidance of executive chef Richard Robinson. But only the best will make it through to the semi-final
S19E17

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
The semi-finalists have their social media skills tested as they are challenged to sell a local street food brand online, under the watchful eye of TIkTok sensation Uncle Roger. Next, Gordon tasks the contestants to devise a recipe to appear on the front page of Waitrose's in-house magazine, before presenting their creations in front of undercover experts including world-renowned food photographer, Mary McCartney. Who will impress Gordon and make it to the final?
S02E07

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc:
Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the case of a family whose once-loved home is now a wrecked shell, after an insurance claim made six years ago went disastrously wrong. Plus, the programme revisits a pledge made in 2018 by then-local government minister Rishi Sunak to keep private parking companies in check
S15E05

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc:
An incident in which a train driver suffered facial injuries after a brick was hurled at his cab, shattering the window. The train was travelling at 70mph, but the driver managed to bring it safely to a standstill, despite his injuries. Rav Wilding reports on how attacks like this have prompted one train company to start installing on-board technology, aimed at making journeys safer for passengers and staff
S03E05

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc:
Officers work to bring a bogus coach company to justice after leaving hundreds of pensions stranded in Torquay, and also track down a loan shark targeting hard-up families
S05E05

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Dion Dublin looks round a chalet-style bungalow in the Derbyshire village of Kilburn and a three-bedroom end terrace in Huthwaite, Nottinghamshire that offers a colourful reminder of his footballing past. Plus, a revisit to a church in Dover that Martin Roberts first saw five years ago
S24E40

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Silversmith Brenton West repairs a boxing trophy won by an accomplished sportsman and much-loved grandfather. Larry Gaines fought professionally from 1923 and refused to let prejudice hamper his career. He was the first black boxer to fight in the Royal Albert Hall and his family is immensely proud of him. Also being restored are a pair of old football boots and a vintage globe. Presented by Jay Blades
S09E10

Kay is adamant this money cannot be touched, but will Dom be able to persuade him to take it? Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun

She decides to make men of them, by putting them in a series of situations that will force them to stand up for themselves. John Hughes' sci-fi comedy, starring Kelly LeBrock, Anthony Michael Hall, Ilan Mitchell-Smith, Robert Downey Jr and Bill Paxton

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.desc: Amol Rajan joins Richard Branson on one of his cruise ships in Miami to discuss his life, loves, passions and challenges. programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Time: Liz McIvor explores how Britain's expanding rail network was the spark to a social revolution, starting in the 1800s and continuing through to modern times. She begins by examining the introduction of precise railway schedules and timetables that recognised Greenwich Mean Time. However, in a country made up of separate local time zones, with clocks in the west set several minutes behind those in the east, not everyone was keen to step in line
S01E01

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
Steaming Down the Road: Fred looks at early experiments in the use of steam for road transport, more than 100 years before the invention of the petrol engine. Plus, an insight into the development of the traction engine for agriculture and haulage
S01E04

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Misunderstandings: A chance encounter leads to an invitation for Jean to stay at her sister-in-law's home, but she has to persuade Lionel to accompany her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E05

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Moving On: Bob takes Terry on a tour of their old haunts - only to reveal most of them have been demolished. Terry finds it difficult accepting that times have changed during his time away - and a job interview proves the last straw. Classic comedy, with James Bolam and Rodney Bewes
S01E04

programme.title: Dam Busters Declassified
programme.desc: Actor Martin Shaw takes to the skies in a bid to separate the facts from the myths surrounding the famous 1943 raid by 617 Squadron, which used bouncing bombs to attack German dams. He also talks to the last living RAF veteran of the mission, as well as to a survivor of the flooding caused by the breaching of the Moehne dam, and meets the secret wartime girlfriend of pilot Guy Gibson

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary-maker Bat-dor Ojalvo is given extraordinary access to one of Israel's most Orthodox Hasidic communities to explore the scandal that erupted when the rabbi who established and led the community died. There follows a story of inheritance battles, violent reprisals, sexual abuse and underage marriages, told by those that experienced it

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Invasion & Defence: David Dimbleby continues his voyage around Britain, sailing his yacht Rocket along coastal regions of the South East, the first point of attack for enemy forces and therefore essential to the nation's defence throughout history. Along the way, he takes a tour of HMS Victory, Nelson's flagship vessel from the Battle of Trafalgar, lovingly preserved in dry dock in Portsmouth. He also meets a carpenter who still makes wooden figureheads, discovers how a chamber pot acted as propaganda in the battle against Napoleon and reveals the way abstract art was used to deceive German submarine pilots
S01E02

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Time: Liz McIvor explores how Britain's expanding rail network was the spark to a social revolution, starting in the 1800s and continuing through to modern times. She begins by examining the introduction of precise railway schedules and timetables that recognised Greenwich Mean Time. However, in a country made up of separate local time zones, with clocks in the west set several minutes behind those in the east, not everyone was keen to step in line
S01E01

programme.desc:
Steaming Down the Road: Fred looks at early experiments in the use of steam for road transport, more than 100 years before the invention of the petrol engine. Plus, an insight into the development of the traction engine for agriculture and haulage
S01E04
