programme.desc: Actor Martin Shaw takes to the skies in a bid to separate the facts from the myths surrounding the famous 1943 raid by 617 Squadron, which used bouncing bombs to attack German dams. He also talks to the last living RAF veteran of the mission, as well as to a survivor of the flooding caused by the breaching of the Moehne dam, and meets the secret wartime girlfriend of pilot Guy Gibson

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Invasion & Defence: David Dimbleby continues his voyage around Britain, sailing his yacht Rocket along coastal regions of the South East, the first point of attack for enemy forces and therefore essential to the nation's defence throughout history. Along the way, he takes a tour of HMS Victory, Nelson's flagship vessel from the Battle of Trafalgar, lovingly preserved in dry dock in Portsmouth. He also meets a carpenter who still makes wooden figureheads, discovers how a chamber pot acted as propaganda in the battle against Napoleon and reveals the way abstract art was used to deceive German submarine pilots
S01E02

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Crewe to Crewe: Victoria Wood makes a round trip of northern England and Scotland starting at Crewe. She visits Carnforth Station, where David Lean shot the memorable location scenes in Brief Encounter, takes a sleeper train from Glasgow to Fort William and stops off at a railway museum in an enthusiast's back garden
S03E01

programme.title: Victoria Wood: A Bafta Tribute
programme.desc: Julie Walters, Lenny Henry, Richard E Grant and Jim Broadbent gather for a gala honouring the much-loved entertainer, with contributions from Peter Kay and French and Saunders. The celebration offers an opportunity to look back over her career with a combination of celebrity tributes and clips of her work, culminating with the presentation of the Bafta award

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc:
With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. The first of two documentaries offers a unique opportunity to see the very best bits of Victoria's work that she loved the most, drawing on some of the 20 sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors including Russell T Davies, Ken Loach, Winsome Pinnock, Jane Wymark and Joan Armatrading discuss Victoria's broad catalogue of award-winning comedy. Narrated by Sara Pascoe
S01E01

programme.title: Duncan Preston Remembers - Pat and Margaret
programme.desc: The actor looks back at Victoria Wood's 1994 comedy drama about a successful actress and her dowdy sister reunited after 27 years apart on a TV show

programme.title: Pat and Margaret
programme.desc: A Lancashire-born American soap star visits Britain on a publicity tour, and is horrified when a live TV show organises a reunion with a motorway cafeteria waitress who happens to be her long-lost sister. Comedy drama, written by and starring Victoria Wood, with Julie Walters, Celia Imrie, Duncan Preston and Thora Hird

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc:
With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. This second of two programmes draws on further favourite sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors discuss her broad catalogue of award-winning comedy
S01E02

programme.title: Victoria Wood: A Personal View - Scene
programme.desc: The writer and comedian discusses her career and her writing, and gives a glimpse of life backstage on her stand-up tour. First broadcast in 1985

programme.title: Mindful Escapes: Breathe, Release, Restore
programme.desc:
Breathe: Mindfulness expert Andy Puddicombe reveals why breathing is so important to becoming still and being in the moment, illustrated with natural history footage
S01E01

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Crewe to Crewe: Victoria Wood makes a round trip of northern England and Scotland starting at Crewe. She visits Carnforth Station, where David Lean shot the memorable location scenes in Brief Encounter, takes a sleeper train from Glasgow to Fort William and stops off at a railway museum in an enthusiast's back garden
S03E01

programme.title: Victoria Wood: A Bafta Tribute
programme.desc: Julie Walters, Lenny Henry, Richard E Grant and Jim Broadbent gather for a gala honouring the much-loved entertainer, with contributions from Peter Kay and French and Saunders. The celebration offers an opportunity to look back over her career with a combination of celebrity tributes and clips of her work, culminating with the presentation of the Bafta award

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team explores the threat of an asteroid impact on earth and meet space scientists who are developing methods of planetary defence that sound like the stuff of science fiction. Maggie meets Professor Alan Fitzsimmons, expert in asteroid observation, to learn how the latest technology monitors near-Earth asteroids. He explains which ones are a current concern, and why we missed the dangerous Chelyabinsk meteor - a 9,000-ton fireball that exploded in the sky above Russia

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Capitalism and Commerce: Liz McIvor examines how the railways stimulated great changes to the nation's economy, and encouraged a new generation of mechanical engineers, skilled workers, managers and accountants. Originally, local entrepreneurs viewed trains as vehicles for shifting raw materials, stock and goods, however it soon became clear that there was money to be made in transporting people
S01E02

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc:
David Olusoga traces the history of an 18th-century sea captain's house near Bristol's docks with links to the slave trade. Bristol was a major port in the transportation of slaves from Africa's Guinea Coast to the Caribbean, and both the man who built the house and its first full-time resident were heavily involved in the trade. David uncovers stories of piracy, abandoned babies, a household slave who made a daring escape from the property, and a protest on the doorstep as the abolitionist movement gained momentum
S03E01

programme.title: Tea with Mussolini (1999)
programme.desc: Eccentric English and American women living in Florence during the tense pre-war years of the 1930s experience the ups and downs of parenthood when they collectively adopt a local boy disowned by his father. However, as international hostilities break out, their happy existence comes under threat. Period comedy drama, starring Maggie Smith, Judi Dench, Joan Plowright, Cher, Lily Tomlin and Baird Wallace

programme.title: Summer Holiday (1963)
programme.desc: Four mechanics embark on a fun-filled trip across Europe on board a double-decker London bus, and enjoy all manner of romantic adventures with three young women who hitch a ride on their way to Athens. However, an unexpected stowaway causes a few surprises. Musical comedy, starring Cliff Richard, Lauri Peters, Melvyn Hayes, Una Stubbs, Ron Moody and the Shadows

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc:
Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema: Pop Music Movies: The critic examines techniques and conventions within a genre that mixes film and music and encompasses many forms, from drama and comedy to fantasy and documentary. There is the classic pop star vehicle, where the biggest acts play themselves, or a version of themselves, as well as dramatised accounts of the stars' lives that dazzle with musical set pieces, while playing on the fascination with the darker side of fame
S03E02

programme.title: Paul Merson: A Walk Through My Life
programme.desc: The football pundit and former Arsenal and England midfielder walks through North Yorkshire, reflecting on his life, career and faith. Carrying a 360-degree camera, he also describes his struggles with drink and gambling addiction

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc:
David Olusoga traces the history of an 18th-century sea captain's house near Bristol's docks with links to the slave trade. Bristol was a major port in the transportation of slaves from Africa's Guinea Coast to the Caribbean, and both the man who built the house and its first full-time resident were heavily involved in the trade. David uncovers stories of piracy, abandoned babies, a household slave who made a daring escape from the property, and a protest on the doorstep as the abolitionist movement gained momentum
S03E01

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Bruno Brookes introduces studio performances from September 22, 1994, by Corona, Michelle Gayle, Suede, Naomi Campbell, Cyndi Lauper, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, and Whigfield, plus a video from Elton John and an appearance over satellite by Bon Jovi

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Claire Sturgess presents the edition first broadcast on September 29, 1994, featuring 2 Unlimited, the Cranberries, Pato Banton, Reel 2 Reel featuring the Mad Stuntman, the Kinks, Snap! featuring Summer, East 17, Shane MacGowan & the Popes, Whigfield and Gary Numan

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 19/05/1983: Simon Bates and Gary Davies present music from May 19 1983, featuring D Train, New Edition, David Grant, Blancmange, the Beat and Wham!

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 21/05/1987: Peter Powell and Simon Bates present the edition first broadcast on 21 May 1987, featuring performances by Cameo, Whitney Houston, Starship and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Queens of Song at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of songs by some of the finest female artists, featuring performances by Whitney Houston, Beyoncé, Mariah Carey, Grace Jones, Cher, Aretha Franklin, Tina Turner, Diana Ross and Adele

programme.title: Viva La Diva: The Queens of Pop
programme.desc: Ana Matronic explores the key elements that have shaped the identities and sounds of Beyoncé, Cher, Grace Jones, Madonna and Mariah Carey, investigating the lives and legacies of these five pop superstars. The Scissor Sisters singer unpicks their triumphs and tragedies to get a better understanding of what makes them so special, before setting out what a diva might look like in the future

programme.title: Grace Jones: Bloodlight and Bami (2017)
programme.desc: Documentary profile of the singer, following her in the recording studio, backstage and at home with her extended family in Jamaica, interspersed with concert footage of hits including Pull Up to the Bumper and Slave to the Rhythm

programme.title: Queens of Song at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of songs by some of the finest female artists, featuring performances by Whitney Houston, Beyoncé, Mariah Carey, Grace Jones, Cher, Aretha Franklin, Tina Turner, Diana Ross and Adele

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Bruno Brookes introduces studio performances from September 22, 1994, by Corona, Michelle Gayle, Suede, Naomi Campbell, Cyndi Lauper, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, and Whigfield, plus a video from Elton John and an appearance over satellite by Bon Jovi

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Claire Sturgess presents the edition first broadcast on September 29, 1994, featuring 2 Unlimited, the Cranberries, Pato Banton, Reel 2 Reel featuring the Mad Stuntman, the Kinks, Snap! featuring Summer, East 17, Shane MacGowan & the Popes, Whigfield and Gary Numan

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 19/05/1983: Simon Bates and Gary Davies present music from May 19 1983, featuring D Train, New Edition, David Grant, Blancmange, the Beat and Wham!

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 21/05/1987: Peter Powell and Simon Bates present the edition first broadcast on 21 May 1987, featuring performances by Cameo, Whitney Houston, Starship and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
The Roof of the World: Following his adventures at Everest Base Camp, the intrepid traveller leaves the mountains behind and moves on to Tibet. Here he discovers that, while there may be an increasing Chinese influence, religion is once again being tolerated. He visits the Potala Palace, the spectacular monasteries of Tashilunpo and takes a dip in a hot spring. From there he continues his journey with a family of nomads heading to a summer horse festival in Yushu
S01E04

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Leaping Tigers, Naked Nagas: The adventurer travels along the Yangtze river into China, where he meets Mosuo singer Namu, who explains the region's traditional walking marriage ceremonies. He continues into India to marvel at one of Assam's great tea estates, makes the acquaintance of the local elephants and stays at a monastery where the monks introduce him to their unique dancing style
S01E05

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
Now Let's Dance!: Cheerful mother of three Ester is about to turn 40 and planning to celebrate the big birthday with all her friends and family. But the day before the party, she receives a phone call that turns her life upside down. Drama, starring Nina Ellen Odegaard. In Norwegian
S01E01

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
A Magical Evening: Ester insists on one last magical night out with her closest friends before the cancer treatment begins. But unbeknown to all of them, Charlotte makes an unsettling discovery. Drama, starring Nina Ellen Odegaard and Sara Khorami. In Norwegian
S01E02

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc:
The Mary Rose: A Timewatch Guide: Historian Dan Snow explores the discovery, excavation and raising of the ship, finding out what the latest research has revealed about the vessel and her crew. The presenter also investigates how the project helped create modern underwater archaeology, and examines the techniques, challenges and successes of the divers and archaeologists involved
S01E01

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc:
With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. The first of two documentaries offers a unique opportunity to see the very best bits of Victoria's work that she loved the most, drawing on some of the 20 sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors including Russell T Davies, Ken Loach, Winsome Pinnock, Jane Wymark and Joan Armatrading discuss Victoria's broad catalogue of award-winning comedy. Narrated by Sara Pascoe
S01E01

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc:
With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. This second of two programmes draws on further favourite sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors discuss her broad catalogue of award-winning comedy
S01E02

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Misunderstandings: A chance encounter leads to an invitation for Jean to stay at her sister-in-law's home, but she has to persuade Lionel to accompany her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E05

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Moving On: Bob takes Terry on a tour of their old haunts - only to reveal most of them have been demolished. Terry finds it difficult accepting that times have changed during his time away - and a job interview proves the last straw. Classic comedy, with James Bolam and Rodney Bewes
S01E04

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
The Roof of the World: Following his adventures at Everest Base Camp, the intrepid traveller leaves the mountains behind and moves on to Tibet. Here he discovers that, while there may be an increasing Chinese influence, religion is once again being tolerated. He visits the Potala Palace, the spectacular monasteries of Tashilunpo and takes a dip in a hot spring. From there he continues his journey with a family of nomads heading to a summer horse festival in Yushu
S01E04

programme.title: John Williams at the BBC
programme.desc: Performances featuring the guitarist, from a BBC archive spanning 50 years. The programme includes classical masterworks, the prog rock of Sky and comedy with Eric Sykes. There are also duets with fellow guitar maestro Julian Bream

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: The naturalist is joined by his stepdaughter and fellow wildlife presenter Megan McCubbin on stage at the Royal Albert Hall as Ben Palmer conducts the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra in music from BBC natural history documentaries. The concert is an audiovisual celebration of the corporation's world-famous Natural History Unit, from David Attenborough's pioneering early adventures through to Frozen Planet II, with images, natural sounds, spoken word sections and music by composers including Hans Zimmer and George Fenton

programme.title: Hans Zimmer: Hollywood Rebel
programme.desc: Profile of the Oscar-winning composer responsible for some of the best-loved film and TV scores of the past few decades. Contributors include directors Christopher Nolan, Denis Villeneuve, and Steve McQueen. In this portrait, Zimmer reveals the musical secrets of his craft - how he goes about terrifying, moving and raising people's spirits through his work

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Tracey Emin: Where Do You Draw the Line? - Imagine: Alan Yentob follows the artist over the course of 12 months to chart her creative process, talking about her life to date and how she sees the rest of her career. Tracey discusses her troubled early years in Margate and the series of breakthroughs in the 1990s that saw her become a leading light of the Young British Artists, featuring career-defining work like My Bed and her embroidered tent Everyone I Have Ever Slept With 1963-1995. Contributors include Nicholas Serota, Jay Jopling, Maria Balshaw and David Dawson

programme.title: Simon Schama Meets
programme.desc:
Simon Schama Meets Ai Weiwei: The presenter speaks to some of the world's most influential contemporary artists and activists. Ai Weiwei discusses his journey to being a voice for the downtrodden, and how his father was both a key figure in the Communist rise to power, only to fall foul of the state during the Cultural Revolution
S01E01

programme.title: Berlin 1945
programme.desc:
Life in the German capital in the year the Second World War ended, told through the stories of those who experienced it - from ordinary Germans to the Allied forces who entered the city. In the final episode, the British, French and Americans troop wait to enter Berlin, while members of the Jewish community, among whom there are few survivors, regroup
S01E03

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: The naturalist is joined by his stepdaughter and fellow wildlife presenter Megan McCubbin on stage at the Royal Albert Hall as Ben Palmer conducts the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra in music from BBC natural history documentaries. The concert is an audiovisual celebration of the corporation's world-famous Natural History Unit, from David Attenborough's pioneering early adventures through to Frozen Planet II, with images, natural sounds, spoken word sections and music by composers including Hans Zimmer and George Fenton

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
The Age of Leisure: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining excursion trains, which became popular from the 1840s onwards, with tourists taking day trips and holidays, and seeing parts of the country they had never seen before. Some trains were set up to satisfy the demand to witness public executions, whereas others transported people to horse racing and sporting events. Working-class northerners had access to the Lake District, however Lakeland resident William Wordsworth was initially unhappy about the new visitors
S01E03

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
Steam on the Water: The development of the steamship, from the earliest paddle boats and the first iron-hulled vessels to modern sport screw propellers and ships powered by steam turbines, such as the Royal Yacht Britannia
S01E05

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc:
Venice: Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore the Italian city of Venice, using 3D technology to discover how a city built in a swamp came to be one of the most powerful locations in Medieval Europe. The pair dive deep into the many canals in this unique place to experience how its buildings still remain standing to this day, and highlight how Venice's beauty once masked a ruthless secret state, and a world of excess and vice
S01E02

programme.title: Saving Venice
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how the Italian city is subject to constant environmental issues, which are becoming more commonplace due to the impact of climate change

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc:
Under Pressure, Over Budget - Part Two: The concluding episode follows the aftermath of the shock news that the Elizabeth Line has been delayed by over a year, and will cost hundreds of millions of pounds more than planned. As the drama unfolds, engineers, technicians and train staff pull together to work on borrowed time, and must learn to operate the new trains and test out the new twin tunnels under London before it can open to the public
S03E02

programme.title: Building Britain's Biggest Nuclear Power Station
programme.desc:
Part two of two. Following the challenges involved with building the Hinkley Point C in the remote Somerset countryside, the first new nuclear power station in Britain for a generation. This time, the team creates an extensive flood defence system to protect the site from a nuclear disaster like the one that befell the Fukushima Daiichi power plant in Japan. Elsewhere, cameras follow specialists as they work to uncover unexploded Second World War bombs that threaten the installation of the 4500-tonne cooling water intake heads
S01E02

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc:
Crisis: Storm chasers and photographers track the global changes in storms and floods across America, while Nasa's Grace satellites reveal global overuse of aquifers
S01E03

programme.title: Novels That Shaped Our World
programme.desc:
The Class Ceiling: The documentary explores how novels through the ages have embraced the class struggle, from Dickens, Gaskell and Hardy through to Robert Tressell's The Ragged-Trousered Philanthropists and the group of working-class writers who began to write their own stories in post-war Britain. With readings by Russell Tovey, Darren Boyd, Alex Macqueen, Emily Berrington, Freddie Fox, Rian Gordon and Olivia Barrowclough
S01E03

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
The Age of Leisure: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining excursion trains, which became popular from the 1840s onwards, with tourists taking day trips and holidays, and seeing parts of the country they had never seen before. Some trains were set up to satisfy the demand to witness public executions, whereas others transported people to horse racing and sporting events. Working-class northerners had access to the Lake District, however Lakeland resident William Wordsworth was initially unhappy about the new visitors
S01E03

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Leaping Tigers, Naked Nagas: The adventurer travels along the Yangtze river into China, where he meets Mosuo singer Namu, who explains the region's traditional walking marriage ceremonies. He continues into India to marvel at one of Assam's great tea estates, makes the acquaintance of the local elephants and stays at a monastery where the monks introduce him to their unique dancing style
S01E05

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
The New Commuters: Liz McIvor examines how the railways enabled people to live farther away from the places where they worked, visiting London and the south east of England, the nation's largest commuter zone
S01E04

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
Steam and the Modern Age: An examination of the major advances made with the invention of the steam turbine, which is still used today to generate electricity in coal-fired and nuclear power stations. Fred also discovers how the country's steam heritage is preserved by museums and societies throughout the country
S01E06

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
The Cruise: Lionel asks Jean to accompany him on an all-expenses-paid cruise, but she remains unmoved by his efforts to woo her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E06

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
I'll Never Forget Whatshername: Terry decides he would like to track down some of his former girlfriends - little suspecting the shocks that await him. James Bolam stars
S01E05

programme.title: Expedition Volcano
programme.desc:
Documentary following scientists studying some of the world's most dangerous active volcanos in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The first of two films explores Nyiragongo, which has erupted twice in the past 50 years, most recently in 2002, when it devastated the nearby city of Goma. However, it lies in a region troubled by war and humanitarian crises, which has made study of the volcano difficult. Former Royal Marine Aldo Kane is given the task of ensuring the team's safety
S01E01

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Animation film based on the voice notes that two Afghan women exchanged in the months that followed the Taliban's return to power in 2021. Raha chose to stay in Kabul, where she was confronted with the violence of the regime. Marwa left with her husband just in time and found herself in a refugee camp in Abu Dhabi, waiting to be welcomed into another country

programme.title: Escape from Kabul Airport
programme.desc: The inside story of the largest airlift in modern US history, which took place in August 2021 when America withdrew its troops from Afghanistan, marking the end of its longest war. The film combines never-before-seen on-the-ground archival footage from the evacuation, alongside interviews with evacuees, eyewitnesses, US Marines and Taliban fighters

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Trade & Romance: David Dimbleby investigates the importance of the sea to trade and to the individual livelihoods of coastal communities. He sails along the west coast of Scotland, starting at Craobh Haven and along the Crinan Canal, a waterway designed by East Lothian engineer John Rennie to take 120 miles off the journey from the west coast to Glasgow and safely avoid the turbulent waters around the Mull of Kintyre. He also climbs aboard the last working sea-going Clyde puffer, where he earns his keep shovelling coal in the steam room, and reflects on the role played by the river in both trade and shipbuilding
S01E03

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary laying bare Chechnya's deadly war against its gay citizens, which reveals the bravery of those running rescue missions to protect the republic's LGBTQ community

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
The New Commuters: Liz McIvor examines how the railways enabled people to live farther away from the places where they worked, visiting London and the south east of England, the nation's largest commuter zone
S01E04

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc:
Under Pressure, Over Budget - Part Two: The concluding episode follows the aftermath of the shock news that the Elizabeth Line has been delayed by over a year, and will cost hundreds of millions of pounds more than planned. As the drama unfolds, engineers, technicians and train staff pull together to work on borrowed time, and must learn to operate the new trains and test out the new twin tunnels under London before it can open to the public
S03E02

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Milton Keynes 2/5: Louise hosts the second night in Milton Keynes, where she hopes to wow her guests with her 'fabulous' menu - including bruschetta and mousse. However, the outspoken PA receives criticism from her guests - will she be able to overcome it to secure the prize?

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
In East Sussex, Jess and her fishing fanatic partner Martin kick off the competition, hosting their first-ever dinner party. However, their overdone burgers and jelly dessert fail to impress competitive couple Peter and Lisa. On day two, Freddy and Anita's traditional Ghanaian menu proves controversial, with cow's feet and tripe too much for Peter and Lisa to swallow. On the last night, Lisa is left fuming and things get a bit awkward she and Peter and Lisa's cooking comes in for some unexpected criticism
S03E86

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Granada Province: Liverpool couple John and Pauline McDonough both have demanding jobs in the pharmaceutical industry and want to find a relaxing bolt-hole to escape to in Spain's Granada province. Laura Hamilton shows them five properties starting at just under £86,000 in the hope that they will make an offer

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Costa del Sol: Mohammad and Salma Aslam from south London have family with a holiday home on Spain's Costa del Sol, and having spent so many good times there, are now determined to buy one of their own. Jonnie Irwin shows them five properties around Fuengirola for their £120,000 budget

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
In Almería, mother-and-son duo Sharon and Shaun Garner catch up with Geoff and Anita, who back in 2019 wanted to swap their Southend-on-Sea coastal life for Spanish inland country views. Meanwhile on the Costa Blanca in the province of Alicante, husband and wife Damon and Sophie Rodriguez are back to meet ex-airforce duo Eileen and Martin, who back in 2018 were looking to retire to the sun
S05E20

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
A couple from Norwich find shoes in their bread oven, and a couple's dream of buying a hamlet in Normandy is in jeopardy when their house sale falls through
S01E11

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Suffolk to meet friends John and Jane who have been collecting and swapping items for many years
S06E06

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hull 1/5: The culinary contest arrives in Hull as five more diners hope to claim the grand prize of £1,000. The first to host a party this week is 29-year-old welfare team leader Jennie, who decides to honour her home city's fishing history with an under-the-sea themed dinner. However, her guests prove to be a lively bunch, twerking their way through dinner, and throwing in a few seal impressions along the way

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hull 2/5: Wrestling promoter and novice cook James hosts the second night in Hull, and he hopes to wow his guests with a Mexican-themed party complete with a wrestling match as the evening's entertainment. However, his costume requirements, and his spicy food, may be too much for some of the attendees

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hull 3/5: Wedding stationery entrepreneur Katrena hosts the third dinner party in Hull, and hopes to impress her guests with a cruise-ship-themed night featuring a pink strawberry soup starter, a sparkling lemon iceberg dessert and towel-folding entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hull 4/5: Mum-of-three Natalie hopes that her choice of good quality produce can help her to impress her guests on the fourth night of the competition in Hull, East Yorkshire. However, the evening does not get off to the best start when community manager George wrongly guesses that she is the grandmother of her two-year-old daughter, and entrepreneur Katrena is insulted by one of the host's questions

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hull 5/5: It is the final dinner party in Hull and the turn of community manager George to entertain the guests. Having spent the week heavily criticising everyone else's cooking, the host faces great scrutiny with his menu of simple yet tasty favourites. It remains to be seen whether his egg drop soup and flambeed crepes Suzettes live up to expectations, before the winner of the cash prize is revealed

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies heads to the Correze region in France to help Alan and Joe find their perfect holiday home. With a budget of £60,000, they're looking for a property near the medieval town of Treignac. Danni shows them five impressive properties, but will any of them be what they're looking for?

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc:
Matt Lucas presents as four more famous faces put their baking skills to the test for charity. Hollywood star James McAvoy, singer and Voice coach Anne-Marie, writer and comedian David Baddiel and former athlete Kelly Holmes are this week's quartet, whose challenges involve decorative tarts, a savoury technical and rendering animals in cake form
S04E02

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc:
Dick, Angel, Arthur and Dorothy share more enchanting tales from the Chateau, as they continue the renovation of their 19th-century fairytale home and grounds. With weddings and events on hold for the second year, Dick and Angel bite the bullet and make the big decision to tackle the exterior of the Chateau. The roof and outside walls are their biggest project to date and the Chateau quickly becomes a building site
S08E01

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc:
An air ambulance is dispatched to the island of Mull, where 23-year-old rally driver Scott has rolled his car down a 20-foot embankment. In Glasgow city centre, the trauma team fight to save the life of a man who was hit by a bus and dragged under the wheels, while the coast guard helicopter flies to a remote sea loch to rescue a woman who has fallen 15 feet down a waterfall
S02E01

programme.title: The Big Fat Quiz of Everything
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a big fat night of pointless sports trivia, with panellists Roisin Conaty, Judi Love, Joel Dommett, Dane Baptiste, Kerry Godliman and Tom Allen pondering Why Paula Radcliffe apologised to the nation, which sports have been played on the moon, and what trademarks belong to Muhammad Ali. Charles Dance heads up the celebrity question setters, alongside the kids of Mitchell Brook Primary School

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc:
On the beat with the police officers of Brighton after dark. Young officers Matt and Will stop an ex-police chief for suspected driving under the influence. But things turn awkward when it turns out she isn't. Determined to prove themselves they attend a suspected arson where they are determined to catch the culprit. Sophie and Rachel investigate a possible street assault that has left a man with life-threatening injuries and Steve comes across a pair of legs sticking out of the bushes. The question is - whose are they?
S01E01

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
Doctors treat 15-year-old Meldred, who has been stabbed in the thigh by a stranger while walking to school, and are concerned that the knife may have caused significant damage or internal bleeding. The medical staff also try to diagnose what is wrong with sports commentator Andrew, who has an inflamed ankle with blood spots and a rash, and treat 11-year-old Penelope, who has hurt her finger falling in the playground
S26E05

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc:
Paramedics treat a man who has taken an overdose of tablets and is refusing to go to hospital, while a six-year-old girl suffers a seizure in a school playground
S05E08

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Anna Richardson is joined by 25 year-old Lauren, a movie buff and professional online gamer from Camberley who is looking for a geeky gamer to be her perfect player two so she can reboot her love life after three years of being single. Ryan who is 28 and from Cheltenham, is looking for his Mr Right. As a sucker for a silver fox and a dad bod, can he find his dream guy to wake up to every morning?
S11E04

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
Schrödinger's Egg: Contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin continue to address the challenges set for them. As the battle for the trophy continues, Greg Davies and Alex Horne take things up a notch by introducing a pulper to proceedings. Jelly babies also cause friction between the participants
S15E07

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Milton Keynes 3/5: Management consultant David hosts the third dinner party in Milton Keynes, and his guests are impressed when he introduces some dancing Las Vegas showgirls. However, with all his focus on entertainment, David makes a major blunder with the food and serves vegetarian Helen a meat dish

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
In East Sussex, the first hosts are childhood sweethearts Robin and Maria. Robin is the brains behind the cooking, but it's up to Maria to ensure the hosting is spot on. Sasha and Leslie are next, and Sasha soon reveals her apparent royal 'connection'. On the last night, Karl and Michael think they are in with a chance of nabbing the £1,000 prize, so long as they can keep their bickering at bay
S03E91

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Gran Canaria: Jasmine Harman helps married couple Ali and Ben Brown from Kent find their ideal property abroad, as she shows them five places on the Spanish island of Gran Canaria

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Fort Lauderdale: Mother and daughter Linnette and Sandra Genus from west London are part of a large extended family spread across the UK, USA and Caribbean. They're now looking for somewhere to host family get-togethers and have chosen the west coast of Florida as the perfect spot. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for their £160,000 budget in and around the city of Fort Lauderdale

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
In Almería, husband-and-wife duo Steve and Sharon Garner help Melanie and Arthur search for their perfect Spanish home for their budget of 295,000 euros
S05E21

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
The owners of a hamlet in France welcome guests to a 50th birthday party and a couple from Eastbourne discover the water has been cut off at their village in Portugal. In France, one of the owners has to spend Christmas alone
S01E12

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit two sisters at their south Wales workshop, where their restorations and upcycles include a Gothic-style organ and a half-size snooker table
S06E07

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Devon 1/5: The first host in Devon, 35-year-old salon owner Hannah, hopes to impress her guests with a menu bursting with taste sensations. But Hannah's technique of combining her favourite flavours may not tickle all of her foodie guests' taste buds. Hannah's night is filled with laughter and revelations, though there is an inkling around that her food is not tasty enough

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Devon 2/5: The second dinner party in Devon is hosted by funeral director and BMX fanatic Simon, who hopes his big portions and 'man food' will win him the cash prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Devon 3/5: Body artist Pascale hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Devon, preparing a Vietnamese menu full of flavour and colour in an effort to impress her guests enough to win the £1,000 prize money. However, her cooking attire for the starter leaves little to the imagination, Nick and Simon find some unusual artwork in her bedroom, Hannah discovers an unwanted guest in her main course, and Nick hits a nerve with Ajay

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Devon 4/5: Nick hosts the fourth night in Devon, preparing a menu that he hopes represents his personality - big, bold and brash - although after his argument with Ajay, he is planning on turning down the banter. However, salon owner Hannah is not impressed with Nick's venison main and ladybird-loving Pascale finds the portions a bit too big. But undertaker Simon is happy to polish off any leftovers - is Nick in with a chance of bagging the £1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Devon 5/5: Estate agent Ajay hopes her nautical-themed evening will see her sail to victory on the fifth and final night in Devon. Along with a gigantic seafood spread, she has also laid on a boat trip around Torquay harbour. However, all does not go quite to plan in the galley. The guests later gather to discover who has won the £1,000 prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lee Juggurnauth heads to Los Gigantes, Tenerife to meet ambulance dispatcher Helen and builder Andrew from Yorkshire who are looking for a holiday home. Armed with a budget of £130,000 , Lee shows the couple five properties with hopes that one of them will be their dream holiday home

programme.title: Billionaire Blooms
programme.desc:
Paula heads to the Netherlands to hunt for the freshest blooms as she prepares for her friend and fellow wedding planner Hannah's big day and with the great and good of the industry invited, she's determined to pull out all the stops. Ricky has his hands full creating a floral wonderland for a birthday party for a seven-year-old, while Philip is hard at work on the annual Chelsea in Bloom extravaganza
S01E03

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc:
Matt Lucas presents as four more famous faces put their baking skills to the test for charity. Hollywood star James McAvoy, singer and Voice coach Anne-Marie, writer and comedian David Baddiel and former athlete Kelly Holmes are this week's quartet, whose challenges involve decorative tarts, a savoury technical and rendering animals in cake form
S04E02

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back (2016)
programme.desc: The nomadic vigilante tries to save an army major who has been framed for murder and treason. Jack Reacher discovers that Turner has been targeted by a secret government conspiracy, and together they go on the run to expose the truth. Director Edward Zwick's blockbusting action thriller sequel based on Lee Child's novel, starring Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders, Danika Yarosh and Aldis Hodge

programme.title: The Big Fat Quiz of Everything
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a big fat night of pointless sports trivia, with panellists Roisin Conaty, Judi Love, Joel Dommett, Dane Baptiste, Kerry Godliman and Tom Allen pondering why Paula Radcliffe apologised to the nation, which sports have been played on the moon, and what trademarks belong to Muhammad Ali. Charles Dance heads up the celebrity question setters, alongside the kids of Mitchell Brook Primary School

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Anna Richardson meets 31-year-old bar supervisor and mum of two Sam from Melton Mowbray who is seeking her own superhero complete with thunder thighs and the smouldering looks of Aquaman. Plus, 34-year-old Tony who has recently left the Royal Marines enlists Anna's help. He already has a son and a dog, but now is looking for Mrs Right to complete 'Team Tony'
S11E05

programme.title: Rebekah Vardy: Jehovah's Witnesses and Me
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The Greatest Auction
programme.desc:
AJ Odudu hosts as collectors bid for a pinball machine signed by Elton John, a fork liberated from Saddam Hussein's palace and a prototype mid-century chair brought in by two sisters who have different feelings about it but are equally desperate to sell it. Plus a 1940s 'fly-o-plane' fairground attraction that was once used to train fighter pilots
S01E02

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Milton Keynes 4/5: Customer services manager and vegetarian Helen hosts the fourth night of the competition in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, and hopes that an East meets West-themed night will win her the £1,000 prize. Hypnotherapist Howard is intrigued by some items he finds in her bedroom, while salesman Simon enjoys her entertainment

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Kicking off the competition in Edinburgh are young lovebirds Andy and Pim, who are hoping to impress their guests with a Scottish and Thai-themed menu - with a bit of American thrown in for good measure. On the second night, the group learns more about Jimmy and Jas's fairy-tale first encounter, as well as Jimmy's fledgling modelling career, which surprises everyone. Night three sees a bromance between Andy and Stuart blossom, and everyone needs an open mind when they sample plumber Stuart and hairdresser Jack's experimental menu
S03E92

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Mojacar, Spain: London couple Rena Sodhi and Donna Carty want a second home that they can escape to in the area of Mojacar in southern Spain. Laura Hamilton unearths a townhouse with stunning views for £25,000 less than their budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: St Lucia: Geri Melville is originally from St Lucia, but moved to the UK when she was just nine. Now, she's ready to return to her roots with her husband Ian, by buying a holiday home together on the island she left almost 50 years ago. With a budget of £360,000 Laura Hamilton shows them five properties boasting views of the Caribbean Sea

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
Sharon and Shaun Garner help Taz and Nicky find a large villa in Almería that can house them and their visiting friends and family, as well as Taz's prized collection of Cortinas
S05E22

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
The owners of a hamlet in the Limousin install a £10,000 septic tank, and a couple move ahead with plans for a sustainable lifestyle by buying hens. Plus, the progress of two estate agents who have spent 30 years rejuvenating a village in Portugal
S01E13

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole comes across a tractor and Simon O'Brien finds a small-wheeled design classic as the pair search for money-making items in Norfolk
S06E08

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gloucestershire 1/5: Former property developer Ian hosts the first dinner party in Gloucestershire, hoping his super-healthy menu will win him the £1,000 prize - although it is possible his guests may be more impressed with his 12-bedroom mansion in the country. Some naked antics, a pinata and stories of millions pounds won and lost make it a night to remember

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gloucestershire 2/5: Then-Miss Cheltenham Sophie hosts the second dinner party in Gloucestershire, hoping her evening of elegant food and pageantry will win her the £1,000 prize. The 24-year-old reveals what she does for a living to her guests, and one attendee makes a surprising confession of her own

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gloucestershire 3/5: Rugby-loving Carmel hosts the third dinner party in Gloucestershire, and she hopes to impress with a 'Six Nations' starter, a pancetta, king prawn and chorizo main, and a Key lime pie for dessert. An attempt to charm her guests backfires when she likens Ian to a psychotic killer, and the atmosphere takes a further knock after Chris gets on the wrong side of Sophie

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gloucestershire 4/5: School teacher Polly, 40, hosts the fourth night of the competition in Gloucestershire, and hopes to impress her guests with a fine-dining experience. She begins with a seafood starter before serving up a meaty main course, and isn't unnerved by the fact she hasn't had any practise cooking either dish. However, her guests show off round the table and threaten to take the attention away from the night, but Ian is highly impressed with Polly's choice of entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gloucestershire 5/5: It is the turn of exuberant hair salon owner Chris to host the final dinner party in Gloucestershire with home-made treats on the menu, including a tiger prawn starter, venison for the main and a dessert of chocolate and walnut ice-cream. Chat around the table reveals some differing opinions after the guests make a discovery in the host's living room, and the group reflect on their time together before the winner of the cash prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2023: Costa Da Caparica: Laura Hamilton helps fitness fans Caron and Ivo hunt for a holiday home in Costa Da Caparica, Portugal, on a budget of £300,000. The pair need enough space for Ivo's five motorcycles and Caron's collection of clothes

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Lake District, 2010: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of Robert and Milla Gaukroger, as they try to add three extensions to a 1980s property overlooking Windermere in the Lake District. Robert has designed his own heating system to achieve maximum sustainability, but the project begins with only £100,000 of the £400,000 budget in place, and he and his family have to move into the existing building while work goes on around them
S10E08

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc:
In Surrey, Kirstie and Phil are searching for homes to bring their house-hunters closer to family. Kirstie meets Lauren, who has decided to move out of her London flat to her own place in Guildford after a serious health scare. She is looking for space to work from home but the high prices in the area leave Kirstie struggling to find a property within budget that ticks all the boxes. Phil meets Eleanor, Laurence and their four-month old twin boys who are moving from Birmingham to be closer to their parents in Surbiton, but with house prices where they are searching being nearly double where they have left, Phil has his work cut out for him
S39E03

programme.title: Grand Designs: The Streets
programme.desc:
Two families from Yorkshire venture into the world of self-build as they attempt to build a new street. Nicola is designing and project-managing a traditional redbrick family home with a modern twist but things start to go wrong when her triangular window, the centrepiece of her vision, does not fit upon arrival. Down the road, Matt and Maryellen are building a flamboyant, Brazilian-inspired home. Steelworker Matt is keen to put his work to good use but Maryellen fears it will make the building feel industrial
S03E01

programme.title: xXx: The Return of Xander Cage (2017)
programme.desc: The extreme sports-loving super spy is brought out of exile when a lethal gang of mercenaries steal a powerful new weapon that threatens the safety of the entire world. He must assemble his own team of adrenaline junkie agents to recover the lethal device. Action thriller, starring Vin Diesel, Donnie Yen, Toni Collette and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
100 Per Cent Bosco: Contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin continue to address the challenges set for them by Greg Davies. At this stage of the competition, it's no surprise that people find retrieving pineapples from a millpond stressful. The comics inventively repurpose umbrellas and - in a fitting climax - Frankie goes to town on a gigantic cat scratching post. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc:

However, things begin to go awry when Howard embarks on a mission to throw his plans off course, and Helen discovers a collection of awards that evidence the host's competitive nature. Meanwhile, Louise finally comes clean about her dislike of David, before the votes are cast and the winner is announced

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Glasgow pair Jean and Ron hope their 'taste of Scotland' menu will impress their guests. Day two sees Colin and Craig try to claw back the limelight and jolly up the mood

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Lanzarote: Jasmine Harman helps couple Jane and David Turnbull, who have a budget of £80,000, to search for a house in Lanzarote. The property must have a lot of potential, and the pressure is on as it will eventually become their retirement home

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.desc:
The owners of a village in France officially open after two years of renovations. Cameras catch up with the man who rescued an abandoned hamlet in Spain who could now lose half of what he bought. Meanwhile, in Portugal, a couple start an animal sanctuary in their village
S01E14

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. Henry is barn searching on his doorstep in Oxfordshire, while Simon makes the long journey down from Liverpool. It's a 'tank off!' as Simon hatches a wacky plan to turn some old tanks into a pizza oven, while Henry turns a redundant water tank into a mobile shelving unit

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: London: The competition heads to south-east London, where first to host is 25-year-old online journalist Leah, who hopes her Mediterranean feast of mixed-mezze and lamb kleftiko will win her the £1,000 cash prize. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: London: Bar manager Josh presents the third dinner party in south-east London, and hopes to wow his guests with a menu inspired by beer. However, they may not be too impressed to find their host's favourite tipple featuring in every course. Josh also cuts corners in the kitchen and tries to hide the fact he has had part of his main meal delivered

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: London: Texan psychologist David hosts the fourth night of the competition in south-east London, and takes inspiration from his passion for Mexican food. However, his guests are surprised by his love of spice, and his elaborate entertainment and controversial conversations make it a party to remember

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: London: On the final day of the competition in south-east London it is part-time event organiser Gina's turn to throw a dinner party. She rolls out an evening of fine dining inspired by her love of cookery courses, but her culinary prowess fails to make an impact on Vincenzo, as he reveals he already ate dinner at home due to his belief that women can't cook. Meanwhile, Leah reveals a surprising beauty secret from her youth during the main course, before a self-penned poem from the host brings tears to David's eyes, and the winner is revealed

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A look back at some of the most memorable staff and patient stories filmed since 2011 at King's College Hospital and St George's in south London - places where life, love and loss unfold every day. At St George's, 22-month-old Daisy arrives by air ambulance after being kicked in the head by a horse. She has a fractured skull, a bruise on her brain and concussion. As surgeons plan their next move, Maggie, an 83-year-old with a lust for life, has suspected sepsis, and five-year-old Roman has a pencil lead stuck in his ear. His mum Annie says Roman is charming and affectionate but can also be a handful

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Durham 1/5: Hairdresser Julie hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham, hoping to win over her guests with a no-nonsense menu she can prepare in advance. Joining her are tough-talking prison transport officer Tina, dreadlocked farm-dweller Stephen, superior IT manager David and glamorous beauty-school teacher Ashleigh. Alliances are quickly forged when David and Tina discover they both love a good gossip, before they turn their attention to Stephen when David compares him to a tramp. Julie overcooks her beef, but will her hosting make up for it and bag her the £1,000 prize?

However, self-confessed snob Tina makes it perfectly clear what she thinks of his efforts

Jean Johansson lines up five potential properties for their budget of £200,000, but will any of them seem the perfect place?

programme.desc: Estranged from her family, Kazu 'Zu' Gamble is a newly sober drug dealer who is left as the sole guardian of her younger, nonverbal autistic half-sister, Music, following the death of their grandmother. Musical drama directed by Sia, and starring Kate Hudson, Maddie Ziegler and Leslie Odom Jr

programme.title: Before We Was We: Madness by Madness
programme.desc:

The group's rise to the top of the charts, pop fame and fortune is set against the backdrop of the ska, punk and new wave revolution of the late 1970s

programme.title: Vera Drake (2004)
programme.desc: A kindly woman living in 1950s London carries out discreet illegal abortions for women in desperate straits, an activity she keeps secret from her family. However, the business is exposed when a young woman falls seriously ill after the operation, leaving her facing prosecution. Mike Leigh's drama, starring Imelda Staunton, Phil Davis, Eddie Marsan and Sally Hawkins

programme.title: The Time Being (2012)
programme.desc: A struggling artist pursues his dreams at the expense of his family's lives. A wealthy eccentric seemingly provides a lifeline by offering him a commission for his work, but as his encounters with his new benefactor grow more unusual, he is forced to reconcile his personal ambitions with his responsibilities. Drama, starring Frank Langella and Wes Bentley

programme.title: Minutes Past Midnight (2016)
programme.desc: Horror anthology featuring stories from the Little Terrors film festival, crammed with demons, cannibals, killers, ghosts, monsters and other horrors. Starring Jason Flemyng

programme.title: Splice (2009)
programme.desc: Two scientists hope to create new creatures for medical purposes by combining DNA from various animals. When their funding is stopped, they secretly create a new creature incorporating human DNA. However, they soon realise they cannot control it, while the relationship between the being and its creators turns dangerous. Sci-fi horror, starring Adrien Brody, Sarah Polley and Delphine Chaneac
A man's life is derailed when a disturbing pattern of events repeats itself in the same manner every day, ending at 2.22 pm. Thriller, starring Michiel Huisman, Teresa Palmer and Maeve Dermody

programme.title: Nightcrawler (2014)
programme.desc: A cynical petty crook is inspired when he sees a freelance camera crew, and decides to go into business filming crime scenes and accidents, then selling the footage to news broadcasters. programme.title: Beasts of the Southern Wild (2012)
programme.desc: A six-year-old girl's father falls ill, and the sickness seems to have a destructive effect on the world around them. As the sea levels rise and prehistoric monsters return to life, the child must go in search of her estranged mother to find a way to restore balance to the natural order of things. Fantasy, starring Quvenzhane Wallis and Dwight Henry

programme.title: A Bigger Splash (2015)
programme.desc: A rock star recovering from surgery retreats to the peaceful surroundings of a Mediterranean island with her lover. Their seclusion is disrupted by the arrival of an old flame and his estranged teenage daughter, and a complex, tempestuous relationship develops between the four of them, bringing old memories to the surface. Drama, starring Tilda Swinton and Ralph Fiennes

programme.title: Lucky Numbers (2000)
programme.desc: A weatherman faces financial ruin when his investment in a snowmobile business is ruined by good weather. Heavily in debt and under threat from criminals, he connives with the presenter of the state lottery to resolve his money worries by rigging the draw. Comedy, starring John Travolta, Lisa Kudrow and Tim Roth

programme.title: Lock Up (1989)
programme.desc: A convict is transferred to a maximum security prison, where he falls foul of a sadistic warden with a grudge against him - and who abuses his position of power to make the inmate's life a misery and destroy his good relationship with the guards. Thriller, starring Sylvester Stallone, Donald Sutherland, Darlanne Fluegel and Tom Sizemore

programme.desc: A Texas Ranger investigates a series of unexplained deaths in a town run by a former Confederate officer. Western, starring Liam Hemsworth and Woody Harrelson
